poems.title-en: Poems Are Not Foreign To Me
poem-en: In my chest, as a ringing string,
The verse will echo real -
And that means, while I am alive,
I might not yet be lost.
Descendants of mine, forgive me
For doing so little to change the world.
For, in this rosy sunset,
I only grieved, giving in to the lyre.
In verses I sought answers -
The unclear requests of the soul.
As if someone had tied
A maiden’s braids around my neck.
As if I have not lost inspiration
In my trembling soul.
At dawn, the rooster’s dashing song
Will speak of this to me.
And moon, old pal of mine,
Don’t try to look
Into my eyes now, cunningly -
Love won’t find a home in them.
poem-rus: Что я так мало сделал в мире,
Любовь в них не найдет приют.

poem-en: Soon, the village
Will welcome me
With the childish cries
In the burdock fields
With the creak
Of bucket-carrying cranes,
By the pond
With the gaggle of geese.
Horse’s eyes
Will shine
With a green sparkle
Of playful fires
On the meadow.
In the coolness of night
I’ll shed the weariness
From my soul -
Even if it’s just the tiniest bit.
I’ve exhausted my lyre,
It’s time to lay down my pen - no good.
For it’s had enough of my harsh muse,
Of my rough words and my heart confused.
As I mourn with my beloved lyre,
Giving in to endless sorrow’s fire.
Life in this world will surely expire,
And I, tormented by an unknown desire.
And will my mournful verse hold sway,
Over those dark forces that hold at bay?
Will noble emotions triumph and stay,
Or will the sinister triumph today?
Perhaps I should let my pen run free,
And let the screeching lyre play with me,
Together we’ll face the world’s misery,
And conquer the evil that holds the key.
poem-rus: Пока грущу я с милой лирой,
А я бог весть о чем томлюсь.
И вместе с нею бой принять
Со злом, что правит в нашем мире.

poem-en: From behind the woods and behind the grove,
Spreading light all around,
Full of life and cheerfulness,
The circle of the sun emerges.
Overwhelmed with happiness,
Sparrows raise their chirping voices:
They’re tired of foul weather,
The sun in the sky is more pleasant to them.
On the fence, with all its feathers fluffed up,
Beating its wings and scattering fluff,
Blinded, drunk with spring,
The eternal suitor - the rooster.
For you have never been stingy,
So splash the warmth all around -
Onto the slumbering nature -
The golden-faced circle of the sun.
Unleash your warmth
Upon my cold soul,
So that I, upon awakening, could
Turn my nose away from dreary sadness.
And yet again the birches sigh,
And sadly tear away a withered leaf.
The air is so transparent and pure,
And the forest is submerged in mysterious silence.
My restless spirit is stirred
By the drunken blue of the holy skies.
I look around with tender sadness -
My chest might burst, my heart might wrench.
I wander across the copper carpet,
Over the burnt-out curls of the maples.
Soon, I too will be burnt-out,
My soul will crumble in fall flames.
Summer’s over… all of it, now it’s gone…
The grass and bushes are burning out.
Everything is now eliminated by a different light,
And you too become someone different now.
One can easily worry their heart,
Giving up to fall melancholy.
Maybe I’m not like others,
Maybe I seem strange, so it be…
The weather changes are becoming more noticeable…
I won’t notice the change of epochs.
As long as hardships bypass us,
And God gives us the gift of farewell.
I’ll take the path through the fields…
Everything around me is dear to the point of pain.
It would be good to become a part of nature,
So that carrying our cross is easier.

poems.title-en: I Will Become A Famous Poet
poem-en: I will become a famous poet,
And it’s not important here
That Pushkin wrote his poems
With only a goose feather.
Esenin, wrote, perhaps,
Putting his heart into pencil.
The time will come for me to write,
Not a “leftist”, but a “rightist” march.
Or maybe, no marches or odes
Need to be written today.
Instead, preserve the holy nature,
And not to drive it into the abyss.
The landfills are growing higher, quarries are getting deeper,
The Earth has long been at the limit of people.
I won’t be a famous poet,
Who is interested in reading about landfills?!
Somewhere there must be life,
Not partying, not lost in vain.
Even if you break into pieces,
There’s another - real life!
It flows unhurriedly,
Obeying the laws of nature.
There, people have bright souls,
And, probably, the skies are bright too.
Maybe they have different gods,
Or maybe different shamans.
There, they follow faith in nature,
Not in churches and temples.
It’s harder to earn bread there,
There are no colorful shows.
And they measure their success
In a different way.
I would run there quickly,
And fall to my knees in tears.
And ask for forgiveness from the people
Who live without spiritual laziness.
If you stepped on the lawn,
The ozone layer has become thinner above you.
If you turn the street into a trash can,
Is this your social protest, man?
Let there be no roaring engine beneath you,
Unless bicycles and rollerblades - nonsense?
People produce waste at lighting speed,
Some - are uncomfortably flushed down the drain, indeed.
Others - pile up in heaps of garbage debris,
Preventing us from moving forward to advanced civilization.
If you pick up a discarded cigarette butt of yours,
Somehow you think it’s your first step towards a civilization of fools…
Don’t let your hand tremble
When you aim the butt at the bin,
Take two more steps towards the bin,
So that people don’t think poorly of you.
Don’t shoot your trash through the window
And don’t throw it from the balcony,
Or the janitor will say:
“What kind of a damn intellectual are you?
You probably escaped from a mental hospital!”
Don’t just stare into emptiness and obsess over your own wealthiness,
Keep the streets clean, like the Germans do in their Germany.
Don’t wait for the City Day lazily and indifferently,
Maximize your intellectual and cultural efforts.
If your appearance is polished, work on your soul too,
Don’t litter the city with glass and other waste.
Cleanliness!
On the sidewalks and in your heart,
Let it be our principle and our cliché!
Walking the streets and alleys,
I try to leave my clean footprint -
So that I won’t be identified by empty bottles
And crumpled cigarette packs.
And if the rhetoric of the authorities bothers you,
Step forward - make your choice.
To peacefully come to human harmony
Without waste and social explosions!
And without wars.
